body_text: It's because the Experimenter API stores and serializes percents as fixed precision Decimals so it's transmitted as a string so you don't wind up getting something like 90.50000001 of Release as a configuration when you meant exactly 90.5%, but it looks ugly to show 90.5000% when you only need to say 90.5%.
body: It's because the Experimenter API stores and serializes percents as fixed precision Decimals so it's transmitted as a string so you don't wind up getting something like 90.50000001 of Release as a configuration when you meant exactly 90.5%, but it looks ugly to show 90.5000% when you only need to say 90.5%.
body_html: It's because the Experimenter API stores and serializes percents as fixed precision Decimals so it's transmitted as a string so you don't wind up getting something like 90.50000001 of Release as a configuration when you meant exactly 90.5%, but it looks ugly to show 90.5000% when you only need to say 90.5%.
